This post is about: I’m making a thing and nobody told me it should be completed in order to be online.

New Site built with Jekyll and hosted on GitHub

written on Sept. 23, 2013 ⋅ in notes

This is a place to poke at code and screw up things. One poke-worthy thing I keep hearing about is Jekyll, so I’m giving it a try. This also gave me something to write about, so I can play with typography and colors.

I thought it would be a good idea to separate the whole website into two main categories—one for general stuff, and another for front-end stuff (that’s what I do).

In case you’re reading this soon after I post it, bear in mind that I’m making it up as I go along. Hell, I haven’t even tested the thing yet.

The first from the notes, September 2013.
